website_summaries.verdict: A nice long press that will work well only with a very large skillet.
pros: Long length works wonders for bacon strips
Size works well with a 12-inch frying pan
cons: Will rust if it is not seasoned properly after use
It is also a bit long

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t rust if cleaned properly. Excellent press
customer_reviews.text: Excellent press!!! But, it needs to be seasoned. Cuisinart didn’t season it well. And don’t believe the reviews that says it rusts... it’s cast iron people, iron rusts unless you dry it with a towel or cloth. You can not leave anything cast iron to air dry. The proper cleaning method is just water and a sponge. Use kosher salt to scrub. Rinse and towel dry and you will never have a rust issue. But other then that, this is a heavy press and well built. It’s not a griswold so don’t expect the absolute best but a great press nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: holly bouchard

customer_reviews.title: Horrible chemical stink. Disappointing for a Cuisinart product.
customer_reviews.text: Beware, this press has been treated with something very toxic smelling. It smells industrial, almost like old motor oil. It's not obvious until it's heated up, so you won't know until you cook with it. I would return it if I could. Had to throw it in the trash. If it smells that bad I think can't be healthy to use it with anything to be consumed!
customer_reviews.author: handy gal

customer_reviews.title: very happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: Meet my expectations, very happy with the results. Good weight, good price. So far, I used on grilled chicken Breast meat. Before, it will take 3 min each side. With using the press, it reduces to 1.5 to 2 min each side. The heat is more evenly on meat. You really do not need expensive grill press. This one works great!
customer_reviews.author: MS L

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: My husband asked for this for Christmas and he was very happy to cook thin burgers. He had been trying but they never turned out how he wanted untill now. I am happy because when he cooks burgers I get a night off cooking. This is a win win for me and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Mary

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not built well
customer_reviews.text: Low quality as seen in the broke handle and half shot screw. Arrived In this condition and not worth sending back at this price. Faster for me to just replace the handle myself. I’d opt for a better built model if given a mulligan.
customer_reviews.author: steven tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Important  "wannebe" chef  tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help hold down the sausages . It works excellently. Just enough weight to keep things down. A little on the large side . But it can cover most of a sandwich. A great new tool in my kitchen. The wood on the handle allows me to not get burned when I pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Green Tea Learner

customer_reviews.title: Rusting after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: It helped me cook my chicken breasts on stove very nicely. Then I washed it. After drying it started to rust later that evening. Terrible product. Not safe for food. The coating is peeling off and it doesn’t seem safe to be used again.
customer_reviews.author: DarkPrince

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for grilling for large groups
customer_reviews.text: When you just don't have time to flip a piece of meat this thing is ideal. Now you can just heat up the top and place it on top to get both sides cooking at the same time. You do have to be aware since it doesn't have a constant heating source that you have to reapply to get desired results but still much better than waiting. Though you lose the ability to make the grill marks... just show the other side.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN YIP

customer_reviews.title: Wooden handle cracked and fell apart after 2 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: After several uses over 2 weeks making smash burgers, bacon, sausage, etc the wood handle cracked and split into several pieces. Apparently only the cast iron can handle the heat. Now the handle just free spins making it quite challenging to do anything other than pick it straight up and set it straight back down. If you want to use this to tilt and take a peek at your food or help you scoop anything up like the bacon you just had it pressing, you can forget it. The spinning handle makes this impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: This is working out really well for me. Hubby doesn't like his burgers rare and, when they shrink up and get thicker in the middle they get too well done for my taste. This flattens them out nicely, saves cooking time because they aren't so thick any more, and if I want mine more rare, just don't put it on my burger after I flip them! Good price, also.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: It is not square with the surface
customer_reviews.text: This is a good example of things I shouldn't be purchasing online. You would think that when this arrives it would lay flat on a flat surface. But, I set this on my granite countertops and there are two opposite corners that are curled up. That is kind of disappointing considering I purchased this to cook bacon. So, if you are using to cook thick burgers it will work great, but if you are using it to keep things like bacon or ham flat in a surface you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: hidden name

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough.
customer_reviews.text: It's good enough but I wish it is heavier. Just make sure to wipe it dry after washing and season it each time as it will rust.
customer_reviews.author: Teknoray

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CABBAGE PRESS FOR MAKING KRAUT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic for pressing cabbage to make pickled kraut. It fit the plastic tub perfect and laying body weight on the cabbage and working across until it is all pressed every 20 minutes for 2 hours makes all the juice needed to get those jars filled with cut cabbage and its own juice for the perfect pickled kraut. It could probably be used for other purposes but that's what I bought mine to do and it does it GREAT!!! Yes, I rinse the salt/cabbage juice off good after using and hand dry it to keep it from rusting.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Will rust if you don't season it.
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, it was covered in rust. Also, and this was my fault, I should have paid more attention to the size as it was probably designed for commercial sized fry grills or bar-b-que grills... it was too big to fit into any of my pans - except my largest cast iron skillet. I'll keep it for cook outs, but will now look for a smaller grill press that is either pre-seasoned or made of a non-rust alloy.
customer_reviews.author: France17

customer_reviews.title: Chipped handle
customer_reviews.text: I just received my cast iron grill press today I was excited to use it but the handle was chipped when I open the box. The chipped piece wasn’t in the box so I know that it was sent to me like that. I still used the grill press. The product held up but disappointed about the chipped handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Never had 1 before and pleasantly surprised. Really heavy, but surprisingly does not squash grill cheese. Cooks bacon perfectly and cuts grease splattering by A LOT. Why have I never had 1 before? Crazy right?!?! Ordering for my daughters! Not sure what else to use it on, excited to find out. OH, put thru dishwasher, no dry heat. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Debra C

customer_reviews.title: Hot, pressed sandwiches for life!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my significant other for Valentine’s and we absolutely love it! Great for grilled cheeses and steak nights. The product weighs a decent amount and has no problem pressing sandwich after sandwich. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for something like this, but has no idea what they are buying and think this might be it... either way the thing has been useful! :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea A

customer_reviews.title: Handle burned off in 5 months, these should have ...
customer_reviews.text: Handle burned off in 5 months, these should have cast handles. I understand the idea behind the wood, it's supposed to be cooler to the touch. They are still too hot to handle bare handed.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made but Not Heavy Enough For My Purposes
customer_reviews.text: One of the main uses I had in mind was pollo al mattone- basically made by flattening a spatchcocked chicken with a brick. It's not heavy enough for that. You can put this thing on a burger or a sandwich I suppose. I should have just picked up a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz and Cocktails

customer_reviews.title: The grilling accessory that gives me an extra hand.
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect addition to my camping and grilling gear. Is very easy to clean, very sturdy, and cuts my grilling time trapping the juices on my steaks, chicken and burgers. I like the fact that is a little heavy and if I keep it hot it leves grilling marks to my meat.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Too long for a pan
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but I bought it to use in my pan and it is just a hair too long to fit in a normal pan, so you’ll need a griddle or flat pan if you’re looking to use it on bacon or tempeh etc...
customer_reviews.author: G.F.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had waited ONE WEEK to buy this item. They marked it down 50% since I bought mine.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great item. Have been using it regularly, but the joy is not all it could be because less than a week after I bought mine (along with a Weber Spirit II Grill) Amazon marked it down 50%. Arrrggghhh!
customer_reviews.author: JCh- Albuquerque

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: It does it's job as a press, but could be a little wider as need extra pressing to do a whole burger. I ended up purchasing a 12"X12" press to cover entire burger all at once and be able to cover a bacon weave entirely.
customer_reviews.author: KBeam

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: Obviously I like these enough to buy three. They work great when I use my griddle. Complaints- they take a bit to clean and dry and I wish they were just a BIT larger. Or maybe I wish cuisanart offered a larger size. But buying these from Amazon warehouse is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fraczek

customer_reviews.title: 👍 Great
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly like the picture and will go perfect with the Father's Day Gift Basket Theme!! The recipient will definitely love their gift when they receive it on Father's Day. This is exactly one of the things that was requested. 👍
customer_reviews.author: indigo2true

customer_reviews.title: Two chipped handles!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and the initial handle was chipped and dinged up. The sencond handle came with a smaller chip but was still rough to the tough. I'm going with another brand as I expected more from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Coating peels off after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Had this a year now. You can see by the picture that the coating is peeling off. We had pieces of it on our bacon when trying to cook it.
customer_reviews.author: jlaf

customer_reviews.title: Nice Press for the Grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is really nice to keep the hamburgers flat when we cook them on the grill and also for steaks to crisp them on the outside. The wooden handle is a nice touch and classes it up; better than the last press I bought!
customer_reviews.author: teamhaskett

customer_reviews.title: Ok weight
customer_reviews.text: This is not the 60's or 70's weight that if you dropped it on your foot might sever your toes you find in the commercial kitchens, and the wood handle showed up cracked almost in half! It will serve the purpose for a sometimes used device at home, but I can tell you the handle was born with a very limited lifespan.....
customer_reviews.author: Hawkbox

customer_reviews.title: Great for even cooking !
customer_reviews.text: I like using this because it cooks meats more evenly and thorough without having to continually flip the meat over and over and over again. Now I know why they use them in restaurants !
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for bacon
customer_reviews.text: Works great for bacon! Bayou Classic 7433 Cast Iron Square Skillet,... + Excelsteel Stainless Steel 12-1/4-Inch Square... which fits great, + two Cuisinart CGPR-221 Cast Iron Grill Press ... that fit under the screen. It is a great set up!
customer_reviews.author: Hey!

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok
customer_reviews.text: This works ok. It is large though and not the best for using in a pan. It would be best suited for a griddle use. It would be good for using on a grill outdoors. I was hoping to use it on bacon, but have gone back to my old way of just working it out in the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Normandin

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality well built product. We use it daily with no issues. Great for making panini sandwiches. Easy to clean. The handle is wood so if it gets wet you have to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: a generally good product and does what it should. has a nice weight to it. MY ONLY COMPLAINT If hand washing (which you definetely should because it can get very greasy, I even have to double or triple scrub) Dont put down on metal part to dry, my got a little bit rusty.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Grigorenko

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy - rusts
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this product but it rusted after one use . It doesn’t come with any specific cleaning instructions regarding how to clean or not clean this item. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Grace H Austin

customer_reviews.title: Looks good except for the crack in the handle
customer_reviews.text: It is what I expected. The only issue is, it has a 1/4" crack on one end of the handle. The crack does not affect anything, but quality control stinks.
customer_reviews.author: KC of Indy

customer_reviews.title: Handle is cracked and wiggles right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart has always delivered in terms of quality, and if not for one rather importation aspect, I wrote say the same if this product. This time around I'm disappointed. Right out of the package the handle has a crack at the end of it and nicks over the of the handle as well. The handle also wiggles and doesn't tighten down with use is the screws in the end of it. Amazon, I would include a pic for this review, but... although I enabled access to my camera, and I have been able to include photos before, for some reason it won't let me take a picture here.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Earrings

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the handle on this. It makes it easy to apply pressure to flatten the food that needs flattening. Other reviewers have indicated that it is good for holding food in place while cooking, and I can see that this would be the case. It has a nice heaviness to it.
customer_reviews.author: MB!

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today with a handle that’s cracked in 2 different places. Apparently there is quality control.
customer_reviews.author: dbcooper

customer_reviews.title: Good Selection
customer_reviews.text: Very happy, definitely wanted rectangle and a large one is hard to find ! This one is heavy, large, and has a very nice handle, was going to go with Lodge but they did not have the size I was looking for. Love this one !
customer_reviews.author: Careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: you must take proper care of this or it will rust.
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. It speeds up cooking time and has enough weight to give your items cross marks just like a grill. Great for hamburgers, sausage and bacon. Just be weary about proper cleaning procedure. That is why I put 1 star on cleaning because you have to treat this grill press like the cast iron griddles you have back in the 70s and older.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne K Madairy Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great for Paninis
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because my husband kept stealing the teapot to press down on paninis. We haven't used it on the Grill yet, but we've made countless amounts of Grilled Cheese sandwiches and other sandwiches on our griddle where we have needed a weight and this has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Orangeroses29

customer_reviews.title: Was 5 stars now 3
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Works great! UPDATE: after less than a year and not that many uses the handle split completely. I never put it in the dishwasher, always washed by hand and never soaked the wood handle. I’m disappointed it didn’t last longer, kind of useless without the handle and I’m way past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Can't do without having one of these. It is heavy and perfect for bacon and chicken and you name it. Yes, Get it. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: IT IS NOT FLAT ON THE BOTTOM!
customer_reviews.text: IF I WOULD OF PAID ATTENTION TO DETAILS, I WOULD OF NEVER BOUGHT IT, IT HAS RIDGES ON THE BOTTOM, REALLY DISAPPOINTING...
customer_reviews.author: David Sloan

customer_reviews.title: A little big
customer_reviews.text: Press is very nice. Solid cast iron with a wooden handle. It’s a little bigger than intimidated. Planned on using it with pans for cooking bacon, chicken, bacon. Maybe it’ll work better on the grille. Superb quality, just a tad large. I still love it though.
customer_reviews.author: FDCarter

customer_reviews.title: It rusted the first time we used it and continued rusting after each use
customer_reviews.text: This was wonderful to use but it began to rust the first time we used it and continued to rust with each use. I certainly don't want rust on my food. Very disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for father's day for those who BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I bet you won't get a review like this ever 😂 I bought this for my ex husband so my child can give it to her dad for father's day .
customer_reviews.author: Diana R Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Treat this as cast iron or it does rust. A lil pricey for just a hunk of iron and a handle but it appears well made.
customer_reviews.author: Halfway smart most of the time.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for bacon and Taylor Ham (aka Pork Roll). It’s large so you will need to use it t in a large frying pan.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Brizek

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! It helps when I make burgers & grill cheese sandwiches & other things. I’m glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: JstBre_007

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Love these, bought two of them for my Blackstone grill, makes such a big difference to how the food cooks. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: F. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice grill press
customer_reviews.text: Nice, heavy grill press. I use mine on raw hamburger meat to press down my sliders that I make in my air fryer. It's perfect for flattening out the meat and pushing the seasoning in. Easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: MarniTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if needed but I spray with oil before I apply to the meat to avoid meat sticking to it.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if needed but I spray with oil before I apply to the meat to avoid meat sticking to it. Good tool for the money!
customer_reviews.author: don kersten

customer_reviews.title: make bacon flat
customer_reviews.text: this is a great bacon cooker. love it you don:t have to worry about your bacon rolling up
customer_reviews.author: jimmie gann

customer_reviews.title: Love my grill tools!!
customer_reviews.text: Love my grilled food!! Love my tools. I put them in a toolbox under the grill. Easy to grab what I need!!
customer_reviews.author: Key-Wee’s mom

customer_reviews.title: Bacon
customer_reviews.text: Don't want your bacon rolling up? Perfect! Easy to clean? Why clean it? You don't wash cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Allen S

customer_reviews.title: Not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves to make grilled sandwiches. This presser works wonders. Easy to clean and not heavy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Maritel

customer_reviews.title: First try ... Perfect Bacon ... WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time cooking bacon this morning and it was cooked perfectly, now I can't wait to try burgers, grilled cheese or anything else on my flat top. Think of the possibilities...
customer_reviews.author: SeaLeopard

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight and even
customer_reviews.text: This grill press came in handy during the barbecue and charity event we had for my boys school event and really helped out with cooking the salmon burgers!
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: It is not super easy to clean, leave black marks.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use however cleaning it is a little tough. I wish I bought something flat instead of with grill marks. It makes is hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Iko

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This has also been great on the range. We use it for grilled cheese, toast, quesadillas and cuts down on cook time for chicken, bacon etc.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Must have in your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great. I use it to toast my sandwiches made with subrolls & tortilla. It is just great
customer_reviews.author: Miro

customer_reviews.title: the greatest
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for bacon on a Blackstone grill absolutely love the quality of this item
customer_reviews.author: paulie

customer_reviews.title: Hamburger perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Just thought this would help out the hamburger steaks my husband loves. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Carole Moe

customer_reviews.title: Professional grill press
customer_reviews.text: If you are serious about using a grill press, this one is about as good and “bulletproof” as you could purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. T

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: I really loved having a heavy press but unfortunately it rusted after 1st use. I dried it well. I like it alot but only down side was rusted
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: This is a must! Sturdy, smooth, great weight!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for for my husband's father's day gift. He was a little too excited. It is out and ready for grilling steaks or burgers. I plan on buying more due to always inviting friends and family over.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it a couple times and I like it. I didn’t think about the wood handle and cleaning! I work in process plants all over the country and the one thing you can’t have is wood in a plant. The wood handle is sealed so I spray it with a bleach product wipe it off. It is a very good product and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Bacon press
customer_reviews.text: I like this presses weight and easy to maintain if you have owned and used cast iron before your going to like this.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Spell Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my needs
customer_reviews.text: For their size, they work, but they are way too small to cover bacon strips. I bought 2 of these for cooking bacon on my Blackstone griddle... with both, I can barely do 5 strips of bacon at a time and it doesn't completely cover the bacon.
customer_reviews.author: SaltwaterSlick

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart is a company that you can trust for quality.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well made, should last a lifetime .Looks nice, wood handle. I've recommended this to family members -- otherwise they'll take mine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W Foster

customer_reviews.title: Little disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Like the weight, great for cooking on my flat grill. However, the handle has a crack, rust smell even cleaning without soap.
customer_reviews.author: Thea

customer_reviews.title: very practical
customer_reviews.text: I find that speeds the cooking time of the stove grill. Helps meat to cook evenly and flatter (ex. pork chops). My grill cheese sandwiches cook faster too. versatile tool.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Davila

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very substantial. I have owned more than one of these. This is the biggest and heaviest one I have ever purchased. It also has ridges on it instead of being flat. I really like this item.
customer_reviews.author: Homestead maker

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy steak weight
customer_reviews.text: haven't used it yet, but seems to be of very high quality
customer_reviews.author: George Keil

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: Even though it’s heavy, it works fine on grilled cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Reader

customer_reviews.title: Handle broken
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift and part of the wooden handle was broken when it arrived, but didn’t know until they opened
customer_reviews.author: James Kelly Speck

customer_reviews.title: Good Weight!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy enough to be a PRESS! Well made, professionally pre seasoned.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Milliron

customer_reviews.title: Love this press!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this press and makes burgers cook faster and better.
customer_reviews.author: Veta  Richardson

customer_reviews.title: May purchase a second one for a gift
customer_reviews.text: When you pick up the press, its obviously well constructed. Heavy but not too heavy. Definitely does the job. Used the first time to make smashburgers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: Its cast iron, so I will not clean it, but nice weight for nice marks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This item does exactly how it is described to work. Highly recommend purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: 777-777 Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my smashburgers
customer_reviews.text: Simple. Sturdy, easy to handle press. Inexpensive. Make SMASHBURGERS with them!
customer_reviews.author: derbagger22

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill press for Grill Line!
customer_reviews.text: We liked that it is well weighted, enough weight to press down on burgers and such. We also liked the heat resistant handle. It is cast iron so you have to wash it properly to prevent rust.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: Easy-peasy... there are screws to take off the wooden handle for seasoning if for no other reason than to keep rust away. Seasoned 4 times and its awesome!! If the wooden handle breaks all you need is a dowel rod to replace. Fantastic design so it can be used forever. Clean the same way you would iron skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Poor

customer_reviews.title: I can't wait to try it on my outdoor gas grill!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have only used this to grill bacon, breakfast sausage patties and grilled cheese sandwiches on an electric griddle. I love it. It cooks these items faster and browns them perfectly. I can't wait to try it on my outdoor gas grill!
customer_reviews.author: curiousitd

customer_reviews.title: For grilling enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: A happy purchase. I use it to ensure an even cook for burgers and steaks. Must have for “well done” fans.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Large Grill Press
customer_reviews.text: This is 9" long so it's too big for 8 inch lodge pans. So I can only use on the grill. It seems sturdy enough, will update review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Coating comes off
customer_reviews.text: Coating comes off getting all in your food. Doesnt seem safe. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Glad i bought this
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad i bought this. We make alot of grilled cheese sandwiches this time of year.
customer_reviews.author: Kara will

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to. What more can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Tisha Huntsman

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a huge difference when grilling Burgers. Keeps meat flat for even cooking, And beautiful grill marks. Love these irons!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: A nice option
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid, heavy but not too heavy. Have had no problems with the handle. I use a metal tooth brush to rinse it off and everything comes off easily. Keeps my bacon nice and flat. Have also used for steaks. Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your griddle!
customer_reviews.text: I love this press. It works great for the griddle or making your sear marks for steaks. I also use it for a bacon press on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Every serious cook needs this grill press.
customer_reviews.text: Restaurant quality! Easy to clean . Great for pressing burgers and bacon!
customer_reviews.author: Mildred Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great Press
customer_reviews.text: Bought the cuisinart grill press to go along with my cast iron grill pan and it is the perfect match. After doing some research I decided to go with this one mainly because the long spaced out ridges on it, most of them have tiny little squares which I didn't like, I wanted to be as close as my cast iron pan to allow the juices and fat to flow out of the meat. The Couisinart is very nicely made cast iron press, it's perfect. It has the perfect weight and size.
customer_reviews.author: Ducatista

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a store I run. It is used all day every day and they have held up well for several months now. The best we've had so far. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the grill press! Heavy and easy to clean!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what a meat press should do, and it cleans up easily. Being rectangular in shape, it was easy to find a place for it in my already-crowded cupboards.
customer_reviews.author: dbirbman68

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CGPR-221, Cast Iron Grill Press (Wood Handle)
product_meta.description: The Cuisinart Cast Iron Grill Press is a handy tool that makes grilling easier, faster and healthier. Press away unwanted excess fat from your meat and serve up healthier grilled foods. Heat the press on your grill and use it to grill the top side of your food - reducing cooking times and creating incredible grill marks just like the pros. Ideal for making creative paninis right on your grill. The press weighs nearly 3-pound and the comfortable wood handle makes it easy to move around your grill.
feature_bullets: CAST IRON CONSTRUCTION: Durable cast iron press weighs 2. 8-pound
WOOD HANDLE: The wooden handle provides a comfortable grip with a stylish touch
HEALTHY GRILLING: Press out unwanted excess fat and oils from meats
GRILL MARKS: Add incredible looking grill marks to any meat
GREAT FOR SANDWICHES: Make delicious homemade panini sandwiches or grilled cheese right on the griddle!
EASY CLEANUP: Hand wash and dry immediately after washing
